title: New constable, 20, joins her mother, stepfather AND stepsister in the police
text:
A 20-year-old, who has become one of Greater Manchester Police's newest recruits, is following the footsteps of not only her mother, but her stepfather and stepsister by joining the police force.

Lauren Jackson attested as a police constable on 13 August 2019, joining the other three members of her family who are also currently serving officers in GMP.

Lauren Jackson (pictured middle right) will join her mum Tina (far right) her stepfather Inspector Jim Jones (far left) and stepsister Rachel (middle left) in serving Greater Manchester Police

PC Lauren Jackson's mum Tina is currently a Detective Constable at Bury with her stepfather, Inspector Jim Jones part of the Criminal Justice Branch and her stepsister Rachel, a PC in Tameside.

PC Lauren Jackson said: 'I've been really excited to start my training to be a PC. I've wanted to be part of the police for as long as I can remember as I love helping people.

'With my parents also being part of the force, as well as my stepsister – I wanted to follow in their footsteps to make them as proud of me as I am of them.

Lauren is following the footsteps of her mum, Tina, a Detective Constable in Bury (pictured right), stepdad, Inspector Jim Jones (pictured left) who is part of the Criminal Justice Branch, and stepsister, Rachel, a PC in Tameside (middle)

'The training has been really interesting but I just can't wait to get out there.'

Lauren's stepdad, Inspector Jim Jones said: 'It makes me so proud to see Lauren following in my footsteps but also being able to forge her own path within GMP.

'Myself, Tina and Rachel have all been offering words of wisdom and guidance for Lauren's first day out on patrol, and we couldn't be more excited to see where her career takes her.'

Following an intense training course, PC Jackson will be joining the team in Rochdale and is getting ready to start her first shift on Monday 23 December.
description: Lauren Jackson has become one of Greater Manchester Police's newest recruits joining mum Tina, a Detective Constable, stepfather, Inspector Jim Jones and PC stepsister Rachel.
